title: Light Sampling Field and BRDF Representation for Physically-based Neural Rendering. (arXiv:2304.05472v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Physically-based rendering (PBR) is key for immersive rendering effects used widely in the industry to showcase detailed realistic scenes from computer graphics assets. A well-known caveat is that producing the same is computationally heavy and relies on complex capture devices. Inspired by the success in quality and efficiency of recent volumetric neural rendering, we want to develop a physically-based neural shader to eliminate device dependency and significantly boost performance. translated_title: 基于光采样场和BRDF表示的基于物理的神经渲染
translated_abstract: 物理渲染对于展示计算机图形资产中的详细逼真的场景效果至关重要，但制作物理渲染效果是具有挑战性的。本文提出了一种基于神经网络的物理渲染器，以消除设备依赖性并显著提高性能。通过学习的光采样场，我们提出了一种新的光照表示方法来模拟直接和间接光照，并提出了BRDF模型，以实现复杂对象的渲染。
tldr: 本文提出了一个基于神经网络的物理渲染器，使用光采样场和BRDF表示来模拟直接和间接光照，并实现复杂对象的渲染。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a physically-based neural shader using a light sampling field and BRDF representation to model direct and indirect light and enable rendering of complex objects.
